results.title: Another day in paradise
results.creator_credit: Chinese Bookie pictures, Stephen Chin, James Woods and Larry Clark
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Larry Clark’s offbeat road movie delves into familiar territory for the always controversial director, that being the search for or absence of a familial or communal maxim. Based on a novel by Eddie Little, “Another day in paradise” follows the misadventures of two young criminal lovers and part-time junkies Bobbie and Rosie (Vincent Kartheiser and Natasha Gregson Wagner) who team up with the more experienced crime couple Mel and Sid (James Woods and Melanie Griffith) to commit a series of robberies across America. Bobbie, coming from a seriously dysfunctional family (with hints of physical abuse from his father), begins to form a strong familial bond with the childless Mel and Sid. The ‘happy families’ scenario begins to come apart however when the crew begin to get more reckless with their crimes, while falling heavier into drug use. Larry Clark (whose past photographic essays on teenagers inform most of his film work), adopts his usual languid style as the camera casually drifts over young bodies, their boredom only slightly elevated by sporadic bursts of violence. In contrast, James Woods gives his familiar intense performance, while Melanie Griffith imbues her role with a unselfconscious charm as the junkie substitute ‘mother’ for this ill-fated family. Cast includes: Lou Diamond Philips, Peter Sarsgaard.

results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Castlezone, Goldcrest, Alan Marshall and Marek Kanievska
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.

results.title: Another case of poisoning
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Health, Richard Massingham and John Waterhouse
results.brief_description: A film for food handlers of all kinds. A warning against the risks of food infection through neglect of the simple rules of hygiene. A food handler, suffering from poisoning is questioned by a doctor. The man recapitulates the events which led up to his illness. The film points out, by looking at the various locations he visited where food was handled, how he may have been infected due to dirty utensils, and unhealthy habits on the parts of cooks and food servers.

results.title: Another beginning
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Brian Adams
results.brief_description: Captures the Ballet Russe from its beginnings in Monte Carlo through its tour of Great Britain (1933) and later of Australia in 1936. The commentator, Wilfrid Thomas, discusses the impact of the Australian tour for the development of dance in Australia. Included are scenes from rehearsals of the Australian Ballet Company.

results.title: Anoop and the elephant
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films, Children's Film Foundation, Hugh Stewart and David Eady
results.brief_description: Engaging and highly entertaining children’s adventure story set in the world of the circus. Anoop, an Indian boy, and his friends attempt to rescue a performing elephant (Riley) from a life in the circus. Cast includes Jimmy Edwards.

results.title: Annie Oakley
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Cliff Reid and George Stevens
results.brief_description: Oscar nominee Barbara Stanwyck stars as Annie Oakley, an Ohio backwoods girl who sets her sights on adventure and romance as the Wild West’s legendary lady sharpshooter. She first gains prominence when she enters a local exhibition with Tony Walker (Preston Foster) who claims to be the world’s greatest marksman and the star of Buffalo Bill’s wild west show. Annie joins the show and soon becomes his star attraction, vying for attention with Toby whom she loves. After the mandatory period of professional rivalry and romantic conflict, they are finally united by a marksman superior to both of them, Cupid.

results.title: Annie Leibovitz
results.creator_credit: LWT, RM Arts, Belinda Allen and Rebecca Frayn
results.brief_description: Formulated on the occasion of a major retrospective on the work of renowned photographer Annie Leibovitz at the International Center of Photography, New York, which toured internationally, this documentary explores Leibovitz’s career from the 1960s to the 1990s and discusses a wide range of her most celebrated work during this time. The program features in-depth interviews with Leibovitz herself about her life, career and particular works and features commentary from her colleagues, art critics and her subjects, including commentary from Mick Jagger, Demi Moore, Hunter S. Thompson and the editors of Rolling Stone and Vanity Fair magazines. Liebovitz is filmed at work on various photo shoots with a focus on sequences surrounding her most compelling images such as the 1977 concert tour with the Rolling Stones, her cover photo of Yoko Ono and John Lennon taken shortly before his death in 1980, and the controversial 1993 cover shot of a naked and pregnant Demi Moore. Through such wide ranging material the program traces the progression and turning points of her life and work and the stylistic visions which signify particular points in her career. It provides a thorough survey on and insight into this major photographer, her documentation of American youth culture, politics, celebrity culture and her own professional and personal aims and achievements.

results.title: Annie Hall
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Charles H. Joffe and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Woody Allen’s satire on the comic anxiety between the sexes in contemporary relationships. When Alvy Singer (Woody Allen), a neurotic night-club comedian, meets Annie Hall (Diane Keaton), a budding cabaret singer, a nervous romance begins. Also stars Colleen Dewhurst

results.title: Annie's Coming Out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: A warm, moving film experience and a triumph of the human spirit. “Annie’s Coming Out” is based on the true story of Annie McDonald. Jessica Hathaway (Angela Punch McGregor) works at a hospital for handicapped children, and among her charges is Annie, a victim of cerebral palsy. Discovering Annie’s considerable intelligence, Jessica endeavours to prove this and must take her case to court in a battle against the establishment.
